conclusion: The light source is initially positioned such that it casts shadows to the right of the objects.
The light source moves to the right and becomes directly above the objects.
Shadows A, B, C, and D will shift towards the left side of their respective objects because the light source is now coming from the right side.
Shadows will likely become smaller as the light source is directly above the objects, reducing the angle of the shadows.
Shadow A (Marlboro Box) moves left and becomes shorter.
Shadow B (Pen) moves left and becomes shorter.
Shadow C (Dragon) moves left and becomes shorter.
Shadow D (Blue Object) moves left and becomes shorter.
When the light source moves to the right and is directly above the objects, the shadows (A, B, C, and D) will shift to the left and become shorter.
